requirements.description: The system shall provide a user interface for creating and managing projects.
The system shall support the creation of project tasks with assigned deadlines and priorities.

children.description: Create a new project task with deadline and priority.
acceptance_criteria: User can initiate task creation through a UI.
UI provides a form for entering task details: Task Name, Description, Deadline (date picker), Priority (dropdown: High, Medium, Low).
System validates required fields (Task Name, Deadline).
System validates date format for Deadline.
System validates Priority dropdown selection.
Upon successful submission, a new task record is created in the database.
The newly created task is displayed in the task list with its details.
Task creation logs are recorded for auditing purposes.

backend: Database Service (Interacts with the Task database)
middleware: Authorization Middleware (Checks user permissions - e.g., can create tasks)
shared: Task Data Model (Task Name, Description, Deadline, Priority, Project ID, Status)

requirements.description: The system shall allow users to track the progress of individual tasks and overall projects.

children.description: Implement a Task Progress Tracking UI component.
acceptance_criteria: The UI displays a visual representation of task progress (e.g., progress bar, percentage).
The UI allows users to update the progress of a task manually.
The UI shows the current status of the task (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Completed, Blocked).
The UI allows users to add comments and attachments to tasks.
The UI integrates with the Task Management API to retrieve and update task data.
The UI is responsive and accessible on different screen sizes.

frontend: Form for updating task progress and comments
UI elements for displaying task status
Styling for visual representation of progress
backend: API endpoint for updating task progress
API endpoint for retrieving task details with progress information
middleware: AuthorizationMiddleware (to ensure user has permission to update task progress)

requirements.description: The system shall enable users to collaborate on projects by sharing files and communicating within the system.

children.description: Implement functionality for users to upload and share files within projects.
acceptance_criteria: Users can upload files of various types (e.g., .txt, .docx, .pdf, .zip) to a project.
Uploaded files are stored securely in a designated storage location (e.g., cloud storage, local server).
Users can set permissions for shared files (e.g., view-only, edit).
Users can download shared files.
File names and metadata (e.g., size, last modified date) are accurately displayed.
File sharing notifications are sent to relevant users.

frontend: File upload component with drag-and-drop support.
backend: File storage service integration (e.g., AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage).
middleware: Authorization middleware (to enforce file access permissions).

children.description: Enable users to create new messages within the system.
acceptance_criteria: Users can initiate a new message creation from any screen within the application.
A modal or inline form is presented for message composition.
The form includes fields for: sender, recipient(s) (single or multiple), subject, body text.
The system validates required fields (sender, subject).
The system supports rich text formatting (e.g., bold, italics, links) in the body text.
The system allows users to select recipients from a user directory or by entering usernames.
The system persists the message data to the database with appropriate metadata (timestamp, status).

middleware: Authorization Middleware (ensure user has permission to send messages)

requirements.description: The system shall provide reporting capabilities to visualize project status and performance.

children.description: Generate a dashboard displaying project status metrics.
acceptance_criteria: The dashboard displays key project status metrics in real-time.
Metrics include: Task Completion Rate, Bug Density, Velocity, Burn-down Chart, and Resource Utilization.
The dashboard is responsive and adapts to different screen sizes.
Users can filter the data by project, team, and time period.
The data refresh interval is configurable (e.g., 5 minutes, 1 hour).
The dashboard utilizes a visually appealing and intuitive design.

children.description: Generate a dashboard displaying project status based on defined metrics.
acceptance_criteria: A dashboard is displayed with key project status metrics.
Metrics displayed include: Task Completion Rate, Bug Density, Velocity, and Burn Down Chart.
The dashboard utilizes a responsive design, adapting to different screen sizes.
Data is updated in near real-time (within 5 minutes).
Users can filter the data by project, timeframe, and team.

requirements.description: The system shall integrate with a version control system (e.g., Git) for managing project code.

children.description: Implement integration with Git for code management. This includes authentication, repository listing, branch management, and commit operations.
acceptance_criteria: Successful authentication with a valid Git provider (e.g., GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket).
The system can list all repositories associated with the user's account.
The system can list all branches within a specified repository.
The system can create a new branch within a repository.
The system can commit changes to a specified branch.
The system can retrieve the latest changes from a remote branch.
The system can handle errors gracefully, such as invalid credentials or network issues.

backend: Git API Client (for interacting with Git repositories)
middleware: Request Validation Middleware (for validating Git repository credentials)
shared: Git Configuration Constants (e.g., Git URL, API keys)

requirements.description: The system shall support role-based access control to restrict user permissions.

children.description: Define and manage user roles within the system. Roles represent collections of permissions.
acceptance_criteria: A database table exists to store role definitions, including a unique role ID, role name, and description.
The system provides an administrative interface to create, read, update, and delete roles.
The administrative interface includes fields for role name, description, and a hierarchical structure (parent-child relationships for inheritance).
The system supports at least three predefined roles: 'Administrator', 'Editor', and 'Viewer'.

backend: Role Service (handles role creation, retrieval, updates, and deletion)
Role Data Model (defines the structure of role data)

children.description: Implement role definition management.
acceptance_criteria: A UI is provided to create new roles with a unique name and description.
The UI allows specifying a role's default permissions.
The system validates role names to ensure uniqueness.
The system stores role definitions in the shared data model (Role).
A REST API endpoint is available to create, update, and delete roles.

frontend: Role List View (Table with Role Name, Description, Actions: Edit, Delete)
backend: Role API Endpoint (POST /roles, GET /roles, PUT /roles, DELETE /roles)
middleware: Authorization Middleware (verify user has permission to manage roles)

requirements.description: The system shall provide a notification system to alert users of important project updates.

children.description: Create an API endpoint to trigger notifications for project updates.
acceptance_criteria: API endpoint `/notify/project_update` accepts a JSON payload containing `project_id` and `update_type`.
The API endpoint returns a 202 Accepted status code on successful submission.
The API endpoint logs the request details (user ID, project ID, update type) for auditing.
The API endpoint is rate-limited to prevent abuse.

requirements.description: The system shall allow users to define custom workflows and processes for their projects.

children.description: Develop a user interface (UI) allowing users to visually construct and edit workflow definitions. The UI should provide drag-and-drop functionality, pre-defined workflow templates, and a clear representation of the workflow's steps.
acceptance_criteria: Users can drag and drop steps from a library onto the workflow canvas.
Users can connect steps to define the flow of execution.
Users can configure each step with relevant parameters (e.g., input data, output data, execution settings).
The UI displays a visual representation of the workflow, showing the connections between steps.
The UI validates the workflow definition to ensure it is syntactically correct and logically consistent.
Users can save and load workflow definitions.

requirements.description: The system shall offer a mobile application for accessing project information on the go.

children.description: Design and develop the mobile application UI for accessing project information.
acceptance_criteria: The application UI adheres to the defined UX/UI design specifications.
The application is responsive and adapts to different screen sizes (minimum: iPhone 6, Android Nexus 5).
All core project information is accessible through the UI.
The UI provides clear navigation and intuitive user interactions.
UI components are accessible and usable according to accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA).

frontend: React Native UI Components (buttons, text fields, lists, navigation)
Styling with Styled Components or similar
backend: API Gateway (for routing requests to backend services)
Project Data Service (for retrieving project information)
User Data Service (for managing user profiles)
shared: API Client Library (for making HTTP requests)

requirements.description: The system shall ensure data is backed up regularly to prevent data loss.

children.description: Create a configurable backup schedule. This includes defining the frequency (daily, weekly, monthly), time of day, and retention period for backups.
acceptance_criteria: A user interface exists to define backup schedules.
The UI allows specifying backup frequency (Daily, Weekly, Monthly).
The UI allows specifying the start time and end time for backups.
The UI allows specifying the number of daily, weekly, or monthly backups to retain.
The system validates the schedule against common constraints (e.g., time zones, valid time ranges).
The schedule is persisted to the database.

middleware: Authorization Middleware (to restrict access to schedule management)

requirements.description: The system shall support multiple languages to cater to a global user base.

children.description: Implement a language selection UI component.
acceptance_criteria: A dropdown menu is displayed on the main page allowing users to select their preferred language.
The dropdown menu displays a list of supported languages (e.g., English, Spanish, French, German).
Upon selecting a language, the UI updates to reflect the chosen language (e.g., text, date formats, number formats).
The UI component is responsive and accessible across different screen sizes.
The language selection functionality does not negatively impact page load times.

frontend: JavaScript for handling language selection events
backend: API endpoint to receive language preference
Service to store user's preferred language
middleware: Authentication middleware (to ensure user is authenticated before storing language preference)
shared: Data model for storing user language preference (e.g., LanguagePreference class)

requirements.description: The system shall provide a comprehensive API for integration with other systems.

children.description: Design and implement a RESTful API endpoint for system integration.
acceptance_criteria: API endpoint `/integration/data` exists.
API endpoint accepts POST requests.
API endpoint validates incoming JSON data against a predefined schema (e.g., using JSON Schema).
API endpoint returns HTTP status codes (200 for success, 400 for bad request, 500 for server error).
API endpoint logs all requests and responses for auditing and debugging.
API endpoint handles rate limiting to prevent abuse.

shared: Data Model for Integration Data (e.g., JSON schema definition)
API Constants (e.g., base URL, API keys)

requirements.description: The system shall adhere to industry best practices for security and privacy.

children.description: Implement a vulnerability scanning process for all code and dependencies.
acceptance_criteria: Automated vulnerability scans are executed on the codebase and all third-party libraries (including container images) during the build process.
A report detailing identified vulnerabilities, their severity, and recommended remediation steps is generated.
The scan frequency is configurable (e.g., daily, weekly, or on commit).
The system integrates with a vulnerability database (e.g., CVE, NVD).
A process is defined for triaging and addressing identified vulnerabilities.

backend: API endpoint for triggering vulnerability scans.
Service to integrate with vulnerability scanning tools (e.g., SonarQube, Snyk, Clair).
Data processing service for analyzing scan results.
Reporting service to generate vulnerability reports.
middleware: Authentication middleware to restrict access to vulnerability management interfaces.
Authorization middleware to control access to vulnerability data based on user roles.
shared: Data model for storing vulnerability information (severity, description, remediation steps, status).
Constants for vulnerability severity levels (e.g., Critical, High, Medium, Low).
Interfaces for integrating with vulnerability scanning tools.

requirements.description: The system shall be scalable to handle increasing numbers of users and projects.

children.description: Implement horizontal scaling for the core engine processing component.
acceptance_criteria: The system can handle 10x the current peak user load without performance degradation (defined as response times under 2 seconds for 95% of requests).
The system automatically scales up/down based on real-time load metrics (CPU utilization, memory usage, request queue length).
A monitoring dashboard displays scaling events and resource utilization in real-time.
The system supports adding new processing nodes without downtime.
The system uses a message queue (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka) for asynchronous processing of large projects.

backend: Data Processing Service: Project Scaling Worker

requirements.description: The system shall provide detailed audit logs for tracking user activity.

children.description: Implement logging of user activity events.
acceptance_criteria: Logs capture user login/logout events with timestamp, user ID, IP address, and browser information.
Logs capture user actions within the system (e.g., data creation, modification, deletion, searching) with timestamp, user ID, action type, and affected data identifiers.
Log entries include sufficient detail for forensic analysis.
Log levels (e.g., INFO, WARNING, ERROR) are configurable.
Log data is stored securely and complies with relevant data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Log rotation and archiving mechanisms are implemented to prevent log file size from exceeding defined limits.
Audit logs are searchable by user ID, timestamp, action type, and data identifiers.

frontend: UI components for user authentication and authorization.
Event tracking scripts to capture user actions and send them to the backend.
backend: API endpoint to receive user activity events from the frontend.
Service to process user activity events and format them for logging.
Data processing logic to extract relevant information from user activity events.
Logging service to write log entries to the log storage system.
middleware: Authentication middleware to verify user credentials.
Authorization middleware to enforce access control rules.
shared: Log data model (e.g., UserActivityLog) defining the structure of log entries.
Logging utility functions for formatting and writing log entries.
Constants for log levels and log storage configurations.

children.description: Create an API endpoint to record user activity. This endpoint should accept user ID, activity type (e.g., login, logout, data access, configuration change), timestamp, and relevant data associated with the activity.
acceptance_criteria: API endpoint `/api/audit/log` is implemented.
API endpoint accepts user ID, activity type, timestamp, and relevant data.
Data is stored in the audit log table with appropriate schema.
API response includes a unique log ID.

backend: AuditLogService: Handles request processing and data storage.
middleware: Authentication Middleware: Verifies user identity before allowing access to the endpoint.
Authorization Middleware: Ensures the user has permission to perform the activity.
shared: AuditLogDataModel: Defines the structure of audit log data.
AuditLogConstants: Defines constants related to audit logging (e.g., log levels).

requirements.description: The system shall support the import and export of project data in various formats.

children.description: Implement API endpoint for exporting project data in JSON format.
acceptance_criteria: API endpoint `/api/v1/projects/export` accepts a `project_id` parameter.
The API endpoint returns a JSON object containing the project data in a format adhering to the defined Project Data Model.
The JSON response includes metadata such as the export timestamp and the total size of the data.
The API returns a 200 OK status code on successful export.
The API returns a 404 Not Found status code if the `project_id` does not exist.
The exported JSON data is valid and parsable.

requirements.description: The system shall provide a user-friendly onboarding process to help new users get started.

children.description: Create a welcome page explaining the core functionality of the system.
acceptance_criteria: A welcome page is displayed upon initial user login.
The welcome page includes a brief description of the system's purpose.
The welcome page includes a call to action to guide the user through the initial setup.
The welcome page is responsive and adapts to different screen sizes.

backend: Service: WelcomeService (responsible for retrieving welcome content)

requirements.description: The system shall be designed with accessibility in mind, adhering to WCAG guidelines.

children.description: Conduct an accessibility audit of the existing codebase against WCAG 2.1 guidelines (Level AA).
acceptance_criteria: A detailed report is generated outlining identified accessibility issues.
The report includes specific WCAG 2.1 success criteria violated.
The report identifies the affected components (frontend and backend).
The report prioritizes issues based on severity (e.g., critical, major, minor, cosmetic).

frontend: Implement automated accessibility scanning tools (e.g., Axe, WAVE) during the development process.
Develop a UI component library with accessibility-ready components.
Create a style guide that enforces accessibility best practices (e.g., sufficient color contrast).
backend: Ensure all API endpoints return data in a structured format (e.g., JSON) that is easily accessible and parsable.
Implement robust error handling that provides informative messages for assistive technologies.
Validate all user input to prevent security vulnerabilities and ensure data integrity.
middleware: Implement authentication and authorization middleware to protect sensitive data and ensure user access control.
Implement request logging middleware to track user activity and troubleshoot issues.
shared: Define a data model that includes accessibility metadata (e.g., alternative text for images, ARIA attributes for dynamic content).
Create a set of utility functions for accessibility testing and remediation.

requirements.description: The system shall provide a self-service portal for users to manage their accounts and preferences.

children.description: Implement User Account Creation Flow
acceptance_criteria: User can successfully register an account with valid email, username, and password.
System validates email format against a predefined regex.
System enforces minimum password length and complexity rules.
Passwords are securely hashed using a strong algorithm (e.g., bcrypt).
User receives a verification email with a unique link.
User can successfully verify their email address via the link.

shared: User Data Model (Email, Username, PasswordHash, VerificationStatus)

requirements.description: The system shall be continuously monitored and maintained to ensure optimal performance and stability.

children.description: Implement a continuous monitoring system to track key performance indicators (KPIs) of the Silmari Context Engine.
acceptance_criteria: The system shall collect metrics such as CPU usage, memory usage, response times, and error rates.
The system shall provide a real-time dashboard displaying these metrics.
The system shall generate alerts when KPIs exceed predefined thresholds.
Alerts shall be configurable based on severity and notification channels (e.g., email, Slack).
The system shall log all events and errors for auditing and debugging purposes.

frontend: Real-time dashboard with charts and graphs for KPI visualization
Configuration panel for setting alert thresholds
backend: API endpoint for retrieving KPI data
Service for collecting and processing metrics from the system
middleware: Authentication middleware for securing the dashboard
Request/response processing middleware for handling API requests
shared: Data model for storing KPI metrics
